body_content.explanation: a result of a particular action or situation, often one that is bad or not convenient:
examples: Not making a will can have serious consequences for your children and other family members.
Eating too much processed food can have dire health consequences.
Scientists think it is unlikely that any species will actually become extinct as a consequence of the oil spill.
The discovery came about as an unintended consequence of a search for something else.
Well, if you insist on eating so much, you'll have to suffer (= accept and deal with) the consequences!
He will have to face the consequences of his actions.
If someone commits a crime, they have to take the consequences.
The money was of little consequence to Tony.
